rajeshwari_83 wrote:

> There is a class which has one public method returning an ArrayList.
> The public method of this class inturn calls several private methods
> which are void. These private methods only keep adding to the
> arraylist which is finally returned by the public method. I need to
> write a JUNIT for this class specifically the private methods of this
> class. Since these methods are void, how do I write JUNIT test cases
> for them???

You have two problems:

1. The methods you want to test return no value.
2. The methods you want to test are not public.

I write about both problems in _JUnit Recipes_, which you can find 
online at www.manning.com/rainsberger

If you prefer to work it out more for yourself, then try using JUnitX to 
solve problem #2. As for problem #1, your method needs to have some kind 
of visible side effect--something you can determine by passing an object 
in to the method (or the object that contains it). If you can identify 
that, then you can make assertions on that.

Take care.
